subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Stupid but True
msgSnippet: Specifically, an attempt to install Thoth on the Mac brings up the Font Book application, with the messages: Problems may have been found with some fonts
messageBody:
Specifically, an attempt to install Thoth on the Mac brings up the
Font Book application, with the messages:

"Problems may have been found with some fonts during validation.
Please review the reported problems before continuing."

"Missing OpenType Data"

"Serious problems were found. Do not use this font."

Does FontForge have a way to create OpenType data?

Ted

On Nov 19, 2007 9:30 AM, Ron Cameron <ronwcameron@...> wrote:
>
>
>
>
>
>
> I'm having trouble getting Thoth to work on the Mac. Especially being
> Unicode, I thought it would work with no problem.
>
> I just downloaded and installed it on my PC at work and it seems fine,
> though. Perhaps I did something wrong on the other platform?
>
> It is interesting that I can view Moira's post and Anthony's second post,
> but his original post still appears as gibberish. I'll have to wait until I
> get home and see if these most recent two work on my Mac.
>
> Ron Cameron
>
>
> Moira O'Brien <mj@...> wrote:
>
>
> F TNk F andDstAnd nQ. /JDOm font ddnt wDk bikoz HX znt a VnikOd vDSn.
>
>
>
> A a matD v intDest, F Am tFpN Hs in /windOz mEl. `en F trFd t tFp t in
> /gMgl mEl it did not wDk.
>
> /mQra
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Anthony Grahn
> To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Monday, November 19, 2007 9:48 AM
> Subject: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Stupid but True
>
>
>
> Sorry for the mysterious characters; I thought I saw evidence that Yahoo
> groups allowed fancier html than I expected. The prior posting happened to
> work on some platforms because missing glyphs are searched for in any
> available font (eg ThothUni on windows). Mea culpa Of course if you have
> ThothUni installed I think you'll be able to read the following on any
> platform:
>
> 乍冊仔 主包仕仔火
>
>
>
> --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Moira O'Brien" <mj@...> wrote:
> >
> > I am bemused! I tried to reply using Jerome which is installed on my
> > computer, but it will not display properly here. Yet your mail is
> displaying
> > below correctly in QS. How did you manage to do this? I have both jerome,
> > thoth and thoth unicode on my computer.
> >
> > Moira
> >
> >
>
